result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on Thursday, February 25, 2016 at 9:00 AM in BR 7, SB Rm 620 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State will move to dismiss this case on the next court date.  Court will hold this in abbeyance.  Further proceedings scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Johnathan D Wallace not in court, in custody. Jennifer Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alan Polan appeared on behalf of Corporation Counsel. Defense counsel waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Case in court for hearing regarding the defendant's competency status. Court found to a reasonable degree of legal certainty that the defendant is not competent and is not likely to regain competency. Court ordered the defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Defendant to be conveyed to the Behavioral Health Division by the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department and held for proceedings under Chapter 51 or Chapter 55. Court ordered that if the Corporation Counsel finds that holding the defendant at the Behavioral Health Unit is not appropriate, the Corporation Counsel shall notify both the State and Defense. Court took no further action.
Order of Conversion to Civil Commitment Proceedings Under 971.14(6), Wis Stats. with attachments signed and filed.

Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Discussion regarding defendant's supervision in the community. Statements made by Milwaukee Police Officer Mark Pollard. Court ordered the defendant's bail be revoked and that he be taken into custody forthwith under Wis. Stat. 971.14(6)(b) to be evaluated for Chapter 51 proceedings. Court ordered a statement be submitted to the Court by 5/20/15 at 1:30 p.m. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Calendar call scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for bail hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard as to bail. Court set a signature bond in the amount of $2,500.00 with turnover to Justice Point Monitoring. Defendant is NOT to be released from Justice Point unless he is released to his aunt Barbara W. or to employees of Life Navigators Kimberly Larry or Denice Mader. Justice Point to contact Kimberly Larry when Mr. Wallace is ready to be released from Justice Point. Contact information is listed on the Justice Point monitoring form. Court vacated return on doctor's report date of 5/12/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jaspers in court requesting this matter be heard earlier than the currently scheduled court date. State notified and does not object. Case adjourned to 5/06/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Bail/Bond Hearing in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction or Modification received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Wisconsin Forensic Unit report written by Dr. Hernke received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Johnathan D Wallace in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
